title: Fix llms.txt stale --all flag reference

Update website docs for v0.5.1 changes

description: Re-implement: (C1) MentionAutocomplete show agent display names as labels, (C2) ComposeBar two-row Slack-style layout, (C3) MentionAutocomplete test updates, (D4) MentionAutocomplete search by agent_id+display+role with agents-first ordering. See dev-docs/failure-recovery/RECOVERY_PLAN.md Groups C + D4.
title: ComposeBar Redesign + MentionAutocomplete — Two-row layout, agent names

description:
## Files
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/inbox/MentionAutocomplete.tsx

## Steps
1. Separate agent and group suggestion building into agentSuggestions and groupSuggestions arrays
2. Agent filter: match against agent.role, agent.agent_id, AND agent.display (all lowercased)
3. Agent label: agent.display || agent.agent_id.replace(/^(agent|user):/, '')
4. Agent sublabel: agent.role
5. Group filter: unchanged (match group.name)
6. Merge: filteredSuggestions = [...agentSuggestions, ...groupSuggestions] (agents first)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Typing @coordinator_ shows coordinator_main as first suggestion
- [ ] Agents appear before groups in dropdown
- [ ] Build passes
title: MentionAutocomplete: search by agent_id+display+role, agents first

description:
## Files
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/inbox/ComposeBar.tsx

## Steps
1. Add removeChip(chip) function that filters selectedRecipients
2. Remove Users import from lucide-react (keep Loader2, X)
3. Restructure form from single-row to two-row:
   - Row 1 (addressing): To: label + allMentions chips (union of selectedRecipients + mentions) + '+ Add' button + recipient dropdown. Hidden when groupScope set.
   - Row 2 (message): flex-1 MentionAutocomplete + Send button inline
4. Chips from selectedRecipients get X button for removal via removeChip
5. Add pt-1 to isImpersonating warning div

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Addressing row above textarea
- [ ] Full-width textarea on its own row
- [ ] Chips show combined recipients
- [ ] Tests pass
title: ComposeBar: Two-row Slack-style layout with removable chips

description:
## Files
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/inbox/__tests__/MentionAutocomplete.test.tsx

## Steps
1. Update mock display values: 'Assistant Bot' → 'assistant_main', 'Research Agent' → 'researcher_main', 'Testing Agent' → 'tester_main'
2. Update ALL label assertions: @assistant → @assistant_main, @researcher → @researcher_main, @tester → @tester_main
3. Update mention extraction assertions: ['assistant'] → ['assistant_main'], ['assistant','researcher'] → ['assistant_main','researcher_main'], etc.
4. Update typed text in tests: 'Hello @assistant and @researcher' → 'Hello @assistant_main and @researcher_main', etc.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All MentionAutocomplete tests pass
- [ ] All 473+ tests pass: cd ui && pnpm test -- -- --run
title: Update MentionAutocomplete tests for agent display names

close_reason: Fixed in f99260b: gitConfigValue() now uses exec.Command directly instead of safecmd.Git to read real git config user.name
description: safecmd.Git injects -c user.name=Thrum on every git command, which overrides git config --get user.name in the user.identify RPC. Fix: gitConfigValue() uses exec.Command directly to bypass the override.
title: Fix user.identify returning Thrum instead of git username

description: Replace all hardcoded cyan-* Tailwind classes and #0d1120 hex values with CSS variable tokens across 17+ UI files. Add 4 new CSS variables. Fix dialog/panel backgrounds to use --panel-bg-start. Fix MessageBubble hardcoded hex colors for light mode. Do NOT modify tailwind.config.js. See dev-docs/failure-recovery/RECOVERY_PLAN.md Groups A + D5 + D6.
title: CSS Variable Migration — Replace hardcoded cyan with CSS var tokens

description:
## Files
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/index.css

## Steps
1. Add to :root section: --accent-glow-soft: transparent; --accent-glow-hover: transparent; --mention-highlight: rgba(8, 145, 178, 0.1); --mention-highlight-self: rgba(8, 145, 178, 0.2);
2. Add to .dark section: --accent-glow-soft: rgba(56, 189, 248, 0.3); --accent-glow-hover: rgba(56, 189, 248, 0.6); --mention-highlight: rgba(56, 189, 248, 0.15); --mention-highlight-self: rgba(56, 189, 248, 0.3);

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] 4 new variables in :root with light values
- [ ] 4 new variables in .dark with dark values
- [ ] Build passes: cd ui && pnpm build
title: Add 4 new CSS variables to index.css for both :root and .dark

description:
## Files
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/ui/button.tsx (5 cyan + 2 shadow rgbas)
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/ui/card.tsx (1 cyan + 1 shadow + slate gradient)
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/ui/dialog.tsx (1 cyan + 1 shadow + gradient → --panel-bg-start/--panel-bg-end)
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/ui/badge.tsx (3 cyan patterns)
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/ui/ScopeBadge.tsx (3 cyan classes)

## Steps
Apply the canonical mapping from RECOVERY_PLAN.md section A2. Key mappings:
- text-cyan-400/500 → text-[var(--accent-color)]
- border-cyan-500/10-30 → border-[var(--accent-border)]
- ring-cyan-500 → ring-[var(--accent-color)]
- from-cyan-600 → from-[var(--accent-hover)]
- to-cyan-500 → to-[var(--accent-color)]
- from-slate-900 to-slate-800 → from-[var(--panel-bg-start)] to-[var(--panel-bg-end)]
- shadow rgba(56,189,248,...) → shadow-[0_0_15px_var(--accent-glow-soft)]

IMPORTANT: dialog.tsx gradient must use --panel-bg-start/--panel-bg-end (NOT --app-bg-secondary)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] 0 cyan- references in these 5 files
- [ ] Build passes
title: Replace cyan classes in UI primitives (button, card, dialog, badge, ScopeBadge)

description:
## Files
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/inbox/ComposeBar.tsx (19 cyan + 1 hex)
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/groups/GroupChannelView.tsx (38 cyan + 2 hex — largest)
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/inbox/MessageBubble.tsx (3 inline rgba + hardcoded hex colors for light mode D5)
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/status/HealthBar.tsx (2 cyan)
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/agents/AgentCard.tsx (1 cyan)
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/Sidebar.tsx (5 cyan)
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/coordination/WhoHasView.tsx (3 cyan)
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/subscriptions/SubscriptionPanel.tsx (2 cyan)

## Steps
Apply canonical mapping from RECOVERY_PLAN.md A2. Key notes:
- bg-[#0d1120] → bg-[var(--panel-bg-start)] (NOT --app-bg-secondary — causes transparent panels)
- MessageBubble: also fix hardcoded hex text-[#e2e8f0], text-[#cbd5e1], text-[#64748b] → use CSS vars (text-[var(--text-secondary)] etc.)
- MessageBubble: hover:bg-[rgba(56,189,248,0.04)] → hover:bg-[var(--accent-subtle-bg)]
- MessageBubble inline mention rgba styles → var(--mention-highlight), var(--mention-highlight-self)
- MentionAutocomplete.tsx: bg-popover → bg-[var(--panel-bg-start)] on dropdown container
- Leave yellow/amber, red, purple, gray untouched

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] 0 cyan- references in all component .tsx files
- [ ] 0 #0d1120 references
- [ ] Build passes
title: Replace cyan classes in feature components (ComposeBar, GroupChannelView, MessageBubble, 5 others)

close_reason: Fixed: Wait now auto-reconnects to daemon with 60s retry. Also fixed user.identify returning Thrum instead of git username (safecmd.Git override).
title: Fix thrum wait orphaned on daemon restart

description: New work: (E) Wire user.identify RPC into AppShell auto-registration to show git config user.name instead of 'thrum'. (F) Redesign AgentContextPanel from large bordered card to thin header bar + gear icon slide-out panel matching GroupChannelView pattern. See dev-docs/failure-recovery/RECOVERY_PLAN.md Groups E + F.
title: Agent View Redesign + Git Username — Minimal header, gear slide-out

description:
## Files
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/AppShell.tsx

## Steps
1. In AppShell auto-registration flow, call user.identify RPC first to get git config user.name
2. Pass the real name to user.register instead of hardcoded 'thrum'
3. Fallback to 'thrum' if user.identify fails

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] UI header shows git config user.name instead of 'Thrum'
- [ ] Fallback works if git config not set
title: Wire user.identify RPC into AppShell for git username display

description:
## Files
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/agents/AgentContextPanel.tsx
- Test: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/agents/__tests__/AgentContextPanel.test.tsx

## Steps
1. Replace the large bordered card with a thin header bar (~40px height):
   - Status dot (online/offline) + agent display name (bold) + role badge + intent text (truncated) + gear icon button
2. Add gear icon click → slide-out panel (absolute right, w-72, same pattern as GroupChannelView settings):
   - Full agent details: AGENT ID, ROLE, INTENT, TASK, BRANCH, UNCOMMITTED (with file list), CHANGED, HEARTBEAT
   - Delete Agent button at bottom behind border-top divider
   - Close X button at top-right
3. Move AgentDeleteDialog trigger inside the slide-out panel
4. Update tests to match new structure

Reference: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/groups/GroupChannelView.tsx lines 170-400 for the slide-out pattern

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Agent header is a single thin bar (not a large card)
- [ ] Gear icon opens slide-out panel with full details
- [ ] Delete Agent is inside slide-out, not inline
- [ ] Messages get maximum vertical space
- [ ] Tests pass
title: Redesign AgentContextPanel: thin header bar + gear slide-out

description: The UI's auto-registration flow in AppShell.tsx registers a 'thrum' user agent via user.register RPC. This agent then appears in the sidebar agent list as 'Thrum' alongside real agents. Either: (a) the UI user should not appear in the agent list, or (b) the agent list should filter out user-type agents. Investigate how AppShell registers and whether the agent list RPC can exclude UI users.
title: Fix phantom 'Thrum' agent in sidebar

description: My Inbox view shows 'No messages' even though messages exist. Root cause: the UI registers as 'thrum' (hardcoded) via user.register, but actual messages are addressed to real agent names like @coordinator_main. The inbox filter matches against the UI's registered identity ('thrum') and finds nothing. Fix: wire user.identify RPC to get git username, then use that as the UI identity so inbox filtering works. This is closely related to thrum-9b7.1 (git username display) — the same user.identify call fixes both the display name and the inbox filter.
title: Fix My Inbox empty — UI identity mismatch drops all messages
Archive completed dev-docs (RECOVERY_PLAN, ui-recovery prompt)
Fix website index.html hardcoded :4100 port
v0.5.1 Release Testing

description: Re-implement: (B1) DaemonRestart port preservation via THRUM_WS_PORT env var, (B2) URL hash routing for navigation persistence in uiStore, (B3) refetchInterval:5000 polling for useMessageList, (B4) refetchInterval:30000 for useSessionList, (D1) MessageList hooks ordering fix + auto-scroll, (D2) Remove useBrowserNotifications from DashboardPage. See dev-docs/failure-recovery/RECOVERY_PLAN.md Groups B + D1 + D2.
title: UI Structural Fixes — Daemon port, hash routing, polling, hooks

description:
## Files
- Modify: internal/cli/daemon.go

## Steps
In DaemonRestart(), add code to:
1. Read prevPort := ReadWebSocketPort(repoPath) BEFORE calling DaemonStop
2. After DaemonStop and sleep, if prevPort > 0: os.Setenv("THRUM_WS_PORT", fmt.Sprintf("%d", prevPort)) with defer os.Unsetenv
3. Verify os and fmt are already imported

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] go build ./cmd/thrum/ compiles
- [ ] Port preserved across thrum daemon restart
title: DaemonRestart port preservation via THRUM_WS_PORT env var

description:
## Files
- Modify: ui/packages/shared-logic/src/stores/uiStore.ts

## Steps
1. Add validViews array with all View type values
2. Add stateFromHash() that parses window.location.hash (URLSearchParams on hash after #) into UIState
3. Add stateToHash() that writes UIState to URL hash via window.history.replaceState (no history spam)
4. Change initialState to merge defaults with stateFromHash() restored values
5. Add uiStore.subscribe() that calls stateToHash on every state change
6. Call stateToHash(initialState) once at startup

Hash format: #view=live-feed&agent=xyz&group=abc

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Refreshing page returns to current view
- [ ] URL updates when navigating between views
- [ ] Tests pass
title: URL hash routing for navigation persistence in uiStore

description:
## Files
- Modify: ui/packages/shared-logic/src/hooks/useMessage.ts
- Modify: ui/packages/shared-logic/src/hooks/useSession.ts

## Steps
1. In useMessageList: add refetchInterval: 5000 after existing staleTime: 1000
2. In useSessionList: add refetchInterval: 30000 after existing staleTime: 30000

Browser clients don't have WebSocket push subscriptions (requires agent session), so polling is the primary refresh mechanism.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Messages appear within 5s of being sent (without page refresh)
- [ ] Tests pass
title: Add polling fallbacks for useMessageList and useSessionList

description:
## Files
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/components/inbox/MessageList.tsx

## Steps
1. Move scrollEndRef (useRef), prevMessageCountRef (useRef), useLayoutEffect (scroll to bottom on initial render), and useEffect (scroll to bottom when messages.length increases) ABOVE the early returns (loading/empty states)
2. Add conversations = groupByConversation(messages).slice().reverse() so newest appear at bottom
3. Add <div ref={scrollEndRef} /> at the end of the scroll area

This fixes React error #310 (Rendered more hooks than during the previous render).

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] No React error #310 on My Inbox or agent inbox views
- [ ] Messages appear newest at bottom
- [ ] Auto-scrolls to bottom on load and when new messages arrive
- [ ] Tests pass
title: Fix MessageList hooks ordering + auto-scroll to bottom

description:

- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/pages/DashboardPage.tsx
- Modify: ui/packages/web-app/src/pages/__tests__/DashboardPage.test.tsx

## Steps
1. Remove useBrowserNotifications call from DashboardPage
2. Remove useCurrentUser import from DashboardPage (no longer needed for notifications)
3. Keep useCurrentUser in the test mock (child components still use it)

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Tests pass (DashboardPage.test.tsx)
title: Remove useBrowserNotifications from DashboardPage
Update dev-docs bug reports with resolution status
